item.title: Jesus Saves
item.description: Handout from Greg I’m going to start with the handout Greg sent by email which will be the focus of the lesson. My reactions are indented along the way. Life Connection In a world where various religious groups seek their own interpretations of salvation, and many individuals question its necessity, even the most self-absorbed among us occasionally sense an emptiness, a yearning for something deeper. Most would be relieved to have just one solid answer defining exactly what salvation is.

item.title: Paul misrepresents Psalm 14
Which side of the faith-works dispute is inspired?
item.description: Justification. Paul says works have nothing to do with it. item.title: Why does Jesus dispute Paul's 'Roman Road' method of salvation?
item.description: If you’ve ever heard an “altar call” in a Baptist church, it almost always concludes with Romans 10:9: That if thou shalt confess with thy mouth the Lord Jesus, and shalt believe* in thine heart that God hath raised him from the dead, thou shalt be saved. The statement is absolute. There’s no maybe in the context. So what’s the problem? Well, the problem is that Jesus disputes it in Matthew 7:21-23.
